Interferometer¶

Interferometer components.

pycis.model.interferometer.mueller_product(mat1, mat2)[source]¶

Compute the product of a Mueller matrix with a Mueller matrix / Stokes vector

Parameters

  • mat1 (xarray.DataArray) – Mueller matrix.

  • mat2 (xarray.DataArray) – Mueller matrix or Stokes vector.

Returns

(xarray.DataArray) mat1 @ mat2, a Mueller matrix or a Stokes vector, depending on the dimensions of mat2.

pycis.model.interferometer.rotation_matrix(angle)[source]¶

Mueller matrix for frame rotation (anti-clockwise from x-axis)

Parameters

angle (float) – rotation angle in degrees.

Returns

(xr.DataArray) Frame rotation Mueller matrix.

class pycis.model.interferometer.Filter(tx, n)[source]¶

Optical filter with no polarisation-dependent behaviour.

Parameters

  • tx (xr.DataArray) – Fractional filter transmission, whose dimension ‘wavelength’ has coordinates in m.

  • n (float) – Refractive index (effective).

class pycis.model.interferometer.LinearPolariser(tx_1=1, tx_2=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Linear polariser

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation in degrees of the transmission axis relative to the x-axis.

  • tx_1 (float) – Transmission, primary component. [0, 1] - default is 1.

  • tx_2 (float) – Transmission, secondary (orthogonal) component. [0, 1] - default is 0.

get_mueller_matrix(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Mueller matrix for a linear polariser

class pycis.model.interferometer.UniaxialCrystal(thickness, cut_angle, material='a-BBO', sellmeier_coefs_source=None, sellmeier_coefs=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plane-parallel uniaxial birefringent crystal plate

Parameters

  • thickness (float) – Crystal thickness in m.

  • cut_angle (float) – Angle in degrees between crystal optic axis and front face.

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, from positive x-axis towards positive y-axis.

  • material (str) – Set crystal material.

  • sellmeier_coefs_source (str) – Specify which source to use for the Sellmeier coefficients that describe the dispersion. If not specified, defaults for each material are set by sellmeier_coefs_source_defaults in pycis.model.dispersion.

  • sellmeier_coefs (dict) – Manually set the coefficients that describe the material dispersion via the Sellmeier equation. Dictionary must have keys ‘Ae’, ‘Be’, ‘Ce’, ‘De’, ‘Ao’, ‘Bo’, ‘Co’, ‘Do’.

  • contrast (float) – An arbitrary contrast degradation factor for the retarder, independent of ray path. Value between 0 and 1. Simulates real crystal imperfections.

get_delay(wavelength, inc_angle, azim_angle)[source]¶

Calculate path delay (in radians) imparted by the retarder

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • inc_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray incidence angle(s) in radians.

  • azim_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray azimuthal angle(s) in radians.

Returns

(float, xarray.DataArray) Imparted delay in radians.

get_fringe_frequency(wavelength, focal_length)[source]¶

Calculate the (approx.) spatial frequency of the fringe pattern at the sensor plane.

Parameters

  • focal_length (float) – Focal length of imaging lens in m.

  • wavelength (float) – Wavelength in m.

Returns

(tuple) x and y components of the fringe frequency in units m^-1 and in order (f_x, f_y).

class pycis.model.interferometer.Waveplate(**kwargs)[source]¶

Waveplate, a special case of the plane-parallel uniaxial birefringent crystal plate (cut_angle=0).

I made this class to speed up the model when fitting to experimental data: the equation for phase delay due to a waveplate is simpler than the general uniaxial crystal case.

Parameters

  • thickness (float) – Crystal thickness in m.

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, from positive x-axis towards positive y-axis.

  • material (str) – Set crystal material.

  • sellmeier_coefs_source (str) – Specify which source to use for the Sellmeier coefficients that describe the dispersion. If not specified, defaults for each material are set by sellmeier_coefs_source_defaults in pycis.model.dispersion.

  • sellmeier_coefs (dict) – Manually set the coefficients that describe the material dispersion via the Sellmeier equation. Dictionary must have keys ‘Ae’, ‘Be’, ‘Ce’, ‘De’, ‘Ao’, ‘Bo’, ‘Co’, ‘Do’.

  • contrast (float) – An arbitrary contrast degradation factor for the retarder, independent of ray path. Value between 0 and 1. Simulates real crystal imperfections.

get_delay(wavelength, inc_angle, azim_angle)[source]¶

Calculate path delay (in radians) imparted by the retarder

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • inc_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray incidence angle(s) in radians.

  • azim_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray azimuthal angle(s) in radians.

Returns

(float, xarray.DataArray) Imparted delay in radians.

get_fringe_frequency(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calculate the (approx.) spatial frequency of the fringe pattern at the sensor plane.

Parameters

  • focal_length (float) – Focal length of imaging lens in m.

  • wavelength (float) – Wavelength in m.

Returns

(tuple) x and y components of the fringe frequency in units m^-1 and in order (f_x, f_y).

class pycis.model.interferometer.SavartPlate(thickness, material='a-BBO', sellmeier_coefs_source=None, sellmeier_coefs=None, mode='francon', **kwargs)[source]¶

Savart plate

Parameters

  • thickness (float) – Total thickness of plate in m.

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, relative to the x-axis.

  • material (str) – Crystal material.

  • material_source (str) – Source of Sellmeier coefficients describing dispersion in the crystal. If blank, the default material source specified in pycis.model.dispersion

  • contrast (float) – An arbitrary contrast degradation factor for the retarder, independent of ray path. Value between 0 and 1. Simulates the effect of real crystal imperfections.

  • mode (str) – Determines how impartedd delay is calculated: ‘francon’ (approx.) or ‘veiras’ (exact).

get_delay(wavelength, inc_angle, azim_angle)[source]¶

Calculate path delay (in radians) imparted by the retarder

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • inc_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray incidence angle(s) in radians.

  • azim_angle (float, xarray.DataArray) – Ray azimuthal angle(s) in radians.

Returns

(float, xarray.DataArray) Imparted delay in radians.

class pycis.model.interferometer.IdealWaveplate(delay, **kwargs)[source]¶

Ideal waveplate imparting a given delay to all rays.

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, relative to the x-axis.

  • delay (float) – Imparted delay in radians.
